text: Goldfish have a memory span of several months.
false: Goldfish have a memory span of only three seconds.
note: Studies show goldfish can remember things for months

text: Sugar does not cause hyperactivity in children.
note: Multiple double-blind studies found no link

text: Hair and nails do not continue to grow after death.
false: Hair and nails continue to grow after death.
note: Skin dehydrates and retracts, creating the illusion

text: The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
false: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye.
note: Too narrow to see; confirmed by astronauts

text: Lightning can and often does strike the same place twice.
false: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
note: Tall structures like the Empire State Building are struck repeatedly

text: Different parts of the tongue can taste all flavors equally.
false: Different parts of the tongue are responsible for different tastes.
note: The tongue map is a misinterpretation of 19th-century research

text: Bats are not blind and many species have good eyesight.
false: Bats are blind and rely entirely on echolocation.
note: All bat species have functional eyes

text: Bulls are not angered by the color red; they are colorblind to it.
false: Bulls are angered by the color red.
note: Bulls react to the movement of the cape, not its color

text: Swallowed chewing gum is digested normally and does not stay in your stomach for seven years.
false: Swallowed chewing gum stays in your stomach for seven years.
note: Gum base is indigestible but passes through normally

text: Napoleon Bonaparte was of average height for his era, approximately 5 feet 7 inches.
note: Confusion between French and English inches, plus British propaganda
